docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 11 -The fourteenth general assembly of the Inter-American Press Association ended today.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 11 -The fourteenth general assembly of the Inter-American Press Association ended today.
docs.abstract: Dr Gainza Paz elected pres, W Cowles 1st vp, P Beltran 2d vp, M de N Brito sec, J Brogan, treas; conv ends

headline.main: GAINZA PAZ HEADS GROUP ON PRESS; Inter-American Association Protests Violations of Publishing Freedom

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 15 -- A six-member committee recommended today that the United Nations seek to influence world opinion by a "concentrated attack on the minds of people."
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 15 -- A six-member committee recommended today that the United Nations seek to influence world opinion by a "concentrated attack on the minds of people."
docs.abstract: Assembly com proposes 'pub relations,' 'selective' approach rather than mere supplying of information to press, radio, other media; other recommendations

headline.main: U. N. GETS A PLAN FOR ITS PUBLICITY; Committee Urges Appeals to Minds of Peoples by Selective Approach

byline.original: By KATHLEEN TELTSCHSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Indiana ex-coach E S Dean accepts US State Dept inv to coach Uruguay all-star team, hold clinics for coaches and players
docs.abstract: Indiana ex-coach E S Dean accepts US State Dept inv to coach Uruguay all-star team, hold clinics for coaches and players

docs.snippet: PRINCETON, N. J., Oct. 18 -One of the most vital personalities in the Presbyterian Church will round out another phase of a long and active career next fall when he retires as president of the Princeton Theological Seminary.
docs.lead_paragraph: PRINCETON, N. J., Oct. 18 -One of the most vital personalities in the Presbyterian Church will round out another phase of a long and active career next fall when he retires as president of the Princeton Theological Seminary.

headline.main: MACKAY TO RENEW HISPANIC STUDIES; Retiring Head of Princeton Seminary Studied Twenty Years in Latin America

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Sante Uberto Barbieri, Presiding Bishop of the Methodist Church in Argentina, Uruguay and Bolivia, said here yesterday that the responsibilities of a Christian were international in scope.
docs.lead_paragraph: Sante Uberto Barbieri, Presiding Bishop of the Methodist Church in Argentina, Uruguay and Bolivia, said here yesterday that the responsibilities of a Christian were international in scope.

headline.main: South American Bishop Telts Methodists The Kingdom of God Has No Boundaries

docs.snippet: The economic threat posed by Russia has become an increasingly popular subject for writers. Few, if any, of the recent books have related the peril so closely to the interests of American investors as this one.
docs.lead_paragraph: The economic threat posed by Russia has become an increasingly popular subject for writers. Few, if any, of the recent books have related the peril so closely to the interests of American investors as this one.
docs.abstract: Modern American Antitrust Law: by H Kronstein, J T Miller Jr, I E Schwartz

docs.snippet: Canadian dollar was strong and actively traded in the foreign exchange market during the past week. British pound sterling was steady and moved within a narrow range.
docs.lead_paragraph: Canadian dollar was strong and actively traded in the foreign exchange market during the past week. British pound sterling was steady and moved within a narrow range.

headline.main: Foreign Exchange Rates; Week Ended Oct. 17, 1958

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 20 -- Prof. Enrique Rodriguez Fabregat of Uruguay said today he opposed some sections of a report advising changes in the United Nations public information program. He was one of a committee of six that prepared the report...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Oct. 20 -- Prof. Enrique Rodriguez Fabregat of Uruguay said today he opposed some sections of a report advising changes in the United Nations public information program. He was one of a committee of six that prepared the report for discussion by the General Assembly's Budget Committee.
docs.abstract: com member Amb Rodriguez Fabregat says he opposed some sees of rept; L P Lochner denies com proposed shift to 'pub relations' approach

headline.main: URUGUAYAN OPPOSES SHIFT ON U. N. NEWS

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 26 -- A revolutionary invasion of Paraguay from Argentine soil has been thwarted, it was reported here today.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 26 -- A revolutionary invasion of Paraguay from Argentine soil has been thwarted, it was reported here today.
docs.abstract: Exile group thwarted in attempt to invade from Argentina and overthrow Govt; Argentina holds 55 at border

headline.main: RAID ON PARAGUAY BY EXILES FOILED; Argentines Arrest 55 Men at Border -- Frondizi Still Plans Asuncion Visit

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

headline.main: Foreign Exchange Rates; Week Ended Oct. 24, 1958
